components/file_finder/file_finder.hpp

00001 #ifndef FILE_FINDER_MAIN_H
00002 #define FILE_FINDER_MAIN_H
00003 
00004 #include "search.hpp"
00005 #include "filename_less.hpp"
00006 #include <map>
00007 
00008 namespace FileFinder
00009 {
00010 
00011 template <typename LESS>
00012 class FileFinderT
00013 {
00014   std::map<std::string, std::string, LESS> table;
00015 
00016   struct Inserter : ReturnPath
00017   {
00018     FileFinderT<LESS> *owner;
00019     int cut;
00020 
00021     void add(const boost::filesystem::path &pth)
00022     {
00023       std::string file = pth.string();
00024       std::string key = file.substr(cut);
00025       owner->table[key] = file;
00026     }
00027   };
00028 
00029   Inserter inserter;
00030 
00031 public:
00032   FileFinderT(const boost::filesystem::path &path, bool recurse=true)
00033   {
00034     inserter.owner = this;
00035 
00036     // Remember the original path length, so we can cut it away from
00037     // the relative paths used as keys
00038     std::string pstring = path.string();
00039     inserter.cut = pstring.size();
00040 
00041     // If the path does not end in a slash, then boost will add one
00042     // later, which means one more character we have to remove.
00043     char last = pstring[pstring.size()-1];
00044     if(last != '\\' && last != '/')
00045       inserter.cut++;
00046 
00047     // Fill the map
00048     find(path, inserter, recurse);
00049   }
00050 
00051   bool has(const std::string& file) const
00052   {
00053     return table.find(file) != table.end();
00054   }
00055 
00056   // Find the full path from a relative path.
00057   const std::string &lookup(const std::string& file) const
00058   {
00059     return table.find(file)->second;
00060   }
00061 };
00062 
00063 // The default is to use path_less for equality checks
00064 typedef FileFinderT<path_less> FileFinder;
00065 }
00066 #endif
